sense.name: an injury to the skin caused by radiation, heat or chemicals
sense.examples: Wear sunscreen to prevent getting a burn at the beach. The survivors of the nuclear blast had extensive radiation burns. The man was treated for smoke inhalation and a second-degree burn. The burns on her face were caused by sulfuric acid.

sense.name: a panful sensation of heat
sense.examples: The spicy food left a burn in his throat. Her fingers felt the burn of cold from holding the ice pack. This ointment will relieve the burn and itch of poison ivy.

sense.name: an area damaged by fire
sense.examples: I noticed several cigarette burns on the carpet. The acres of burn here were caused by a forest fire.

sense.name: intentional process of clearing land with fire
sense.examples: The Mayan farmers use a technique of slash and burn to clear the jungle. The smoke from the annual burn on the slopes outside the villages hung in the air.

sense.name: a light skin abrasion
sense.examples: I got rope burns on my hands from pulling the lines on the jib sail. John uses a thick shaving cream to minimize razor burn on his face.

sense.name: consumption of fuel
sense.examples: Propane gives a clean burn. The second stage of the rocket has begun its burn. The burn of calories during a marathon is quite high. The investors were surprised at the burn rate of the start-up. (metaphoric extension to consumption of funding, the fuel of a company in a manner of speaking)
